vision.notes: Visual capabilities in Buthidae are not explicitly mentioned in the provided context. Further research is needed.

mechanoreception.notes: Scorpions generally rely on mechanoreception through sensory hairs and slit sensilla to detect vibrations and air currents. This is inferred due to the general sensory biology of scorpions.

chemoreception.notes: Scorpions use chemoreception for detecting prey and mates, both through contact chemoreceptors on their pedipalps and through olfactory cues. This is inferred due to the general sensory biology of scorpions.
